#define BLOCK_ARRAY_SIZE   30

Typedef Documentation

typedef unsigned char BLOCK

A BLOCK is a data type element with a set number of bits to represent partitions.
It is defined this way so we can use uint16 from AVR libc instead of unsigned char if we ever decide to port the code to AVR.

Function Documentation

unsigned short clearWall ( BLOCK *  b,
unsigned short  partition_num 
)

Clear a partition bit

Parameters:
b A BLOCK array. (Either bitmapH or bitmapV)
partition_num The partition number. (between 0 and PARTITIONS_MAX/2 - 1)
Returns:
1 on success. 0 if partition_num is out of bound.

void importMap ( const char *  filename,
bitmap_t *  bitmap 
)

Import a maze map represented in ASCII format.
Maps should be 33 lines by 34 characters including newlines

Parameters:
filename Filename to import
bitmap Pointer to bitmap structure
Returns:
Nothing.
bitmap will be modified.

unsigned short  partition_num

Set the bit to indicate the presence of a partition

Parameters:
b A BLOCK array. (Either bitmapH or bitmapV)
partition_num The partition number. (between 0 and PARTITIONS_MAX/2 - 1)
Returns:
1 on success. 0 if partition_num is out of bound.
